newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli soldier wounded in Lebanon shelling.
newsitem.headline: Israeli soldier wounded in Lebanon shelling.

text.p: An Israeli soldier was slightly wounded on Saturday night when his outpost in southern Lebanon was shelled, pro-Israeli militia sources said.
In Beirut, the pro-Iranian Hizbollah (Party of God) said its guerrillas carried out the attack.
"This was a routine operation against the Zionists. It was an attack against a Zionist unit moving near there," a Hizbollah spokesman said.
The pro-Israeli militia sources said the attack took place at the outpost of Sojoud on the edge of Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone and was followed by retaliatory Israeli shelling.
Hizbollah guerrillas are fighting to oust Israeli troops and their local militia allies from a 15-km (nine miles)-wide border zone they hold in south Lebanon.

Israel has held the border strip since its first invasion of Lebanon in 1978. It set the current boundaries of the zone in 1985 after withdrawing the bulk of its forces following a second invasion in 1982.
